description: Knowledge of statistics and computational data analysis (R, Python or MATLAB). Strong programming skills and experience in algorithm development (using Java,...
post_body:
The Broad Institute of MIT & Harvard, a world leader in cancer genome research, is looking for exceptional candidates to join the Cancer Genome Analysis group. The successful candidates will join an interdisciplinary team of bioinformatics analysts, software engineers, genome biologists and clinicians who are working together to identify mutations that lead to cancer, and discover new cancer therapeutics.
We are looking for individuals who are enthusiastic about taking a hands-on, problem-solving approach, and collaborating with engineers and scientist in an informal collegial work environment that is infused with intellectual rigor. The right candidates will have outstanding academic records and strong communication skills, will demonstrate innovative and analytical thinking, and will enjoy working in an interdisciplinary team. The Broad Institute provides a vibrant research environment with close links to MIT, Harvard and the Harvard-affiliated hospitals across Boston. Working in the Broad’s Cancer Program provides the potential for your contributions to be utilized and recognized across the vast global network of researchers in the field of cancer genomics.
Characteristic Duties:
Apply existing and novel algorithms to cancer data sets, analyze data quality, critically review and analyze results, communicate results to biologists, computational biologists, software engineers and clinicians.
Develop data analysis strategies, write algorithms, and deploy computational tools for the exploration of very large cancer data sets, such as The Cancer Genome Atlas project.
Explore novel data visualization tools, with emphasis on integrating diverse data types
Implement algorithms as software for distribution to the global cancer research community
Requirements:
B.S in Computer Science, Bioinformatics, Engineering, Math, Statistics, Physics, or a related quantitative discipline. M.S. degree in same fields is preferred.
Strong programming skills and experience in algorithm development (using Java, Scala, Python, C++/C#).
Knowledge of statistics and computational data analysis (R, Python or MATLAB)
Knowledge of biology/genetics is not required, though it is a plus."
EOE / Minorities / Females / Protected Veterans / Disabilities

description: Experience with either quantitative statistical software packages (e.g., STATA, SAS, R, Mplus, Python) or qualitative data analysis software packages (e.g.,...
job_title: Research Analyst/Sr. Research Analyst, Youth Development
post_body:
$54,500 - $65,000 a year
Child Trends is looking for a Research Analyst or Senior Research Analyst to join its Youth Development research area which brings a multi-disciplinary perspective to its studies of adolescents and young adults and the programs that serve them. Through research, evaluation, indicator development, and technical assistance we seek to inform policymakers and improve front-line practice. This position is based in the Bethesda, MD office.
General Description:
Under the general direction of senior staff members, the Research Analyst/Sr. Research Analyst will be responsible for conducting assigned parts of social science research projects; such as assisting in the development of the research approach, developing data collection instruments and field procedures; participating in and overseeing data collection; applying statistical analysis to quantitative data and/or analyzing qualitative data; and reporting research findings in writing. Candidates
for this position are required to have experience conducting research analyses although both qualitative and quantitative analysis (or mixed methods) are
appropriate. Preference will be given to candidates with either significant quantitative analysis experience, significant qualitative analysis experience, or significant mixed methods experience.
Research Analyst salary: $54,500.00 Sr. Research Analyst salary: $65,000.00
Analyst Responsibilities:
Works on multiple research and evaluation projects simultaneously as a task leader or project manager.
Works both independently and as part of a team to write substantive reports, briefs, and memos.
Manages the timeline, scope of work, budget, and work flow for assigned projects and tasks.
Designs protocols for the collection of quantitative and/or qualitative data.
Manages and contributes to data collection efforts.
Collaborates with colleagues to develop analytical plans and data management documentation.
Analyzes quantitative data using descriptive and inferential statistical analyses.
Analyzes qualitative data using appropriate coding techniques.
Conducts literature reviews and syntheses.
Assists with proposal development.
May conduct qualitative data collection and analysis: design and development of protocols; recruitment and screening of participants; conducting or assisting with interviews and focus groups; and analyzing the data.
May conduct quantitative data analysis: creates, cleans, and runs syntax or commands using statistical analysis software such as SAS, STATA, or R.
May present findings to clients and stakeholders in public forums.
May train and supervise research assistants and support staff.
May contribute to communications and dissemination efforts.
Analyst Qualifications:
Master’s degree in public policy, research methods, public health, program evaluation, psychology, child development, education or a related field, or a Bachelor’s degree plus 3-5 years of relevant experience for Research Analyst. Master’s degree with 2 years of relevant work experience, or Bachelor’s degree with approximately 5-7 years of relevant experience for Sr. Research Analyst.
Excellent project management and organizational skills.
Excellent writing skills, including the ability to clearly communicate complex information for general audiences.
Excellent task management and organizational skills.
Experience with analyzing quantitative and/or qualitative data.
Experience with data collection (e.g., surveys, interviews, focus groups) and data management, preferably in applied settings.
Strong critical thinking skills and problem-solving abilities.
Strong communication skills to support a collaborative working environment.
Ability to work independently and as part of a time.
Ability to both provide and take direction.
Experience with Microsoft Office suite is required.
Experience with either quantitative statistical software packages (e.g., STATA, SAS, R, Mplus, Python) or qualitative data analysis software packages (e.g., NVivo or Dedoose) is required. Experience with both is desirable but not required.
Experience with project management software (e.g., REDCap, GANTT charts, Basecamp) is desirable, but not required. Experience with data visualization (e.g., Tableau, Excel graphs and figures) is desirable, but not required.
How to Apply:
Please click apply to begin your application. When asked by the system to upload your resume, please upload one document that includes your resume, cover letter, transcripts, a writing sample, and three professional references. Materials must be combined into one document in order to be uploaded. If you have any difficulties with this process please email the requested materials to recruitment (at) childtrends.org and make sure to reference the position in the subject line. No phone calls please!
Child Trends, founded in 1979, is a nonprofit, nonpartisan research organization dedicated to improving the lives of children by conducting research and providing science-based information to improve the decisions, programs, and policies that affect children. With annual revenue of $23 million and 192 employees, our clients include federal, state and local government agencies, foundations, and service providers. Our headquarters is located in Bethesda, Maryland, with offices in Minneapolis and Chapel Hill, North Carolina. In 2018, we were recognized as a Great Place to Work for Women, Best Workplace in Consulting & Professional Services and Best Small & Medium Workplace.
Child Trends is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. Protected veterans and individuals with disability encouraged to apply.

description: Experience with Python, R, SQL, or other data science-friendly programming languages. Withum is accepting resumes for Manager for our center of excellence for...
post_body:
Part-time
Withum is accepting resumes for Manager for our center of excellence for audit data analytics (Central Analytics) department. WithumSmith+Brown is a public accounting firm that will provide a candidate with career development opportunities while encouraging work-life balance and a meaningful work environment. The candidate will be working in a rapidly growing and mission-critical department which supports the firm’s audit, tax, forensic, and advisory practice in performing complex data analysis in accordance with professional standards, increasing firmwide efficiency, and increasing effectiveness of engagements. The Central Analytics team is staffed by a core team of advanced data analysts and supported by a pool of part-time analysts embedded throughout the firm’s professional staff.
Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Planning, direction, & completion of simple and complex data analytics projects including recurring standard methodologies, development of new innovative methodologies, and formal sampling and compliance assistance for audits
Developing and managing analytics staff, including providing technical on-the-job training, feedback on analytics work, and supporting their career growth related to analytics
Supervising analytics work at a portfolio level to ensure all open projects are completely in a timely manner meeting departmental metrics
Screening incoming support requests to identify potential data reliability issues and clarify requester needs
Automating recurring analyses at a firm-wide and client level
Providing valuable insight and clarity to engagement teams regarding potential efficiency and effectiveness gains for engagements
Developing and assisting in the delivery of the firm’s data analytics core curriculum for professional staff and part-time data analysts
Managing the assembly, maintenance, and finalization of working papers that support audit and consulting engagements
Adhering to the highest degree of professional standards
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Accounting, or Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/Data Science or similar field with minor in Accounting;
5+ years conducting data analytics in an accounting or finance context, including: data collection and standardization, statistical and non statistical sampling, data reliability assessment, automation of simple analyses;
Knowledge of audit standards, particularly related to supervision, review, and documentation of work meeting quality standards;
Experience with audit data analytics software packages such as MS Excel, IDEA, ACL;
Experience supervising staff on analytics projects, including performing technical and quality control reviews.
Capacity to work independently on projects;
Ability to work effectively with all levels of staff as part of a team or independently;
Strong analytical and problem solving skills, as well as strong verbal and written communication skills.

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience as a data analytics instructor in a workforce training environment, for hands-on software training, statistical concepts, or analysis best practices.
CPA, CFE, CIA, analytic software-specific or equivalent certifications.
Experience with statistical software packages such as SAS, SPSS, Stata, or similar.
Experience with Python, R, SQL, or other data science-friendly programming languages.
Data visualization experience.

Location:
Any Withum location.
Remote position will be considered

Travel: Less than 10%
Withum is an equal opportunity employer- EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their
race, color, religion, national origin, sex, protected veteran status or disability

post_body:
Temporary, Internship
Job Description
Summer intern in the NextGen test team in Littleton NH. This position will provide general help with testing a wide array of cloud infrastructure features and capabilities. They will use open source tools like CloudBench, TestRail, FIO, Elastic Search database, to generate workloads, monitor the system for failures, document failures, file bugs, work with development teams to gather data, help triage problems, and verify fixes.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

At least the first year of Computer Science related classes

Preferred Tech and Prof Experience

Experience with Git, project experience coding in a collaborative team environment, language skills in Python or Java.

EO Statement
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

description: Experience in Python development and debugging. Aptiv Autonomous Mobility....
post_body:
Internship
Aptiv Autonomous Mobility
Our real-world mobility solutions are driving us toward a safer, greener and better connected future. Aptiv is providing the “brain” and “nervous system” for vehicles that will change the face of mobility for people worldwide.

Aptiv’s Autonomous Mobility team is focused on developing, and commercializing autonomous vehicles and systems that enable point-to-point mobility via large fleets of autonomous vehicles in challenging urban driving environments. With talented teams working across the globe, from Boston to Singapore, Aptiv was the first company to deploy a commercial, point-to-point autonomous ride-hailing service based in Las Vegas, Nevada.

In November 2017, Aptiv acquired autonomous vehicle software startup nuTonomy, an integral part of Aptiv’s Autonomous Mobility team. With continued research, development, and both current and future commercial deployments, we are looking for talented and passionate people to join our team.

Work with leading engineers, research scientists, marketers and business development experts, all while enabling the future of mobility. At Aptiv, we believe that our mobility solutions have the power to change the world. For more information, please visitwww.aptiv.com/our-journey and see ourwww.aptiv.com/careers for opportunities.

Join our innovative team
Want to be part of this revolution? Here’s your opportunity. Join the technology company that’s transforming the future of mobility today.
We are seeking a highly motivated Perception Intern to help in achieving our goals.

The ideal candidate will conduct research in computer vision and machine learning systems that have direct application to autonomous driving. The technologies developed during this internship will help autonomous vehicles see the world around them better.
How you'll make a difference:
Build new solutions that will improve autonomous vehicle’s perception of the road agents
Perform prototyping, and evaluation of state-of-the-art algorithms
Introduce your own creative perspective to all stages from prototyping to deployment
What you'll bring:
Graduate student (Masters or PhD) in Computer Science, Computer/Electrical Engineering or relevant field
Experience in Python development and debugging
Experience in building machine learning and computer vision systems using frameworks like PyTorch, Caffe2, Tensorflow, Keras
Research background demonstrated via publications, past internships, projects
Knowledge of software engineering process: software design, source control management, code reviews, etc
Aptiv is an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

description: Proficiency in Python. Third Pole is a growing cardiopulmonary therapeutics company working with world-class partners to develop unique and disruptive therapies...
post_body:
Third Pole is a growing cardiopulmonary therapeutics company working with world-class partners to develop unique and disruptive therapies that will have an immediate impact, saving lives on a global scale. Third Pole’s first therapy is delivered via a tank-free, nitric oxide delivery system which offers a revolutionary solution enabling newborn babies, who currently lack access to this medicine, the ability to be treated.
We are looking for a Principal Embedded Software Test Engineer who desires to make a significant impact in the development and verification of cutting-edge medical devices which generate and deliver Nitric Oxide therapy. Primary responsibility will be as a technical lead to the Software Quality Assurance effort to drive improvements in product quality and the efficiency of the SDLC. This role includes directing both internal and external resources. You will be a champion of software quality processes for the entire company.
Our team ranges from industry veterans to early career individuals who care greatly about improving patients’ lives, utilizing the latest technology, and promoting a culture of active learning and mentorship. Come join our dynamic, cross-functional team to design, implement, and test our new world-changing medical devices.
Responsibilities:
Work closely with other technical development team members, particularly in software, to ensure that system software requirements/designs meet overall system requirements by participating in and conducting code/design reviews
Apply experience in the evaluation and creation of software process activities including requirements analysis and traceability, design documentation, defect tracking and verification and validation
Keep abreast of applicable technical and industry standards, tools, techniques, and methodologies related to software testing, and drive continuous improvement and strategic development of the test processes and procedures throughout the company
Provide leadership and execution for the verification and validation of product software design including requirements analysis, traceability, and testability assessment
Determine and create tests strategies for a variety of software integration levels; this includes verifying requirements, interface simulation, error handling and negative testing as well as development of automated and manual test cases
Validate software-based tools and SOUP/COTS components
Provide oversite to the software build and release process including automated build verification
Provide the software and project team continuous feedback of product quality through the development and reporting of metrics
Support management reporting through concise, timely, and accurate status reports of all verification and validation activities
Minimum Requirements:
BS degree in computer engineering, computer science, electrical engineering and 8+ years of related professional experience
Experience in the development and use of automated test frameworks.
Thorough understanding of creating test protocols for verifying software requirements and designs of medical device software
Experience testing complex electro-mechanical devices controlled by software
Experience with embedded RTOS and knowledge of C
Experience with requirements management system and defect management applications
Experience with tool and COTS/SOUP validation
Familiarity with medical device Quality and Regulatory requirements
Ability to manage, track and upgrade multiple hardware and software configurations
Ability to work in cross functional teams with Systems, Mechanical, Electrical and Software engineers when discovering, documenting, and resolving integration issues
Strong written and verbal communications skills
Demonstrated ability to lead teams of software test engineers and technicians (in-house or contract) and manage a project to success
Nice to have:
Experience leading Medical Device Verification and Validation (V&V)
MS degree in computer engineering, computer science, electrical engineering or related technical discipline
Proficiency in Python
Experience performing risk management of embedded software (e.g. DFMEA or FTA)
Working knowledge of IEC 62304, ISO 14971, ISO 13485 and FDA and EU guidance and regulations related to medical device software
Experience testing touchscreen-based user interfaces
Experience in medical device cybersecurity and its implementation
Equal Opportunity Employer
Third Pole, Inc. provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.
Reasonable Accommodations
The job summary, responsibilities and requirements listed above are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this position, but they are not an exhaustive list of all the responsibilities and skills required of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made for any part of the application or interview process, and to enable qualified individuals with a medical condition or disability to perform the essential functions.
Job Type: Full-time
Experience:
Computer Engineering/Science/Electrical Engineering: 8 years (Required)
Education:
Bachelor's (Required)

Third Pole is a growing cardiopulmonary therapeutics company working with world-class partners to develop unique and disruptive therapies that will have an immediate impact, saving lives on a global scale. Third Pole’s first therapy is delivered via a tank-free, nitric oxide delivery system which offers a revolutionary solution enabling newborn babies, who currently lack access to this medicine, the ability to be treated.
We are looking for a Principal Embedded Software Engineer who desires to make a significant impact developing cutting-edge electromechanical medical devices. You will be a leader in the design and development of software for medical devices which generate and deliver Nitric Oxide therapy. Our team ranges from industry veterans to early career individuals who care greatly about improving patients’ lives, utilizing the latest technology, and promoting a culture of active learning and mentorship. Come join our dynamic, cross-functional team to design, implement, and test our new world-changing medical devices.
Responsibilities:
Design and develop maintainable software systems utilizing embedded C, following company and industry best practices
Write and own software requirements and specifications
Provide effort estimations for large tasks
Lead architecture design, hardware interface programming, and algorithm design/implementation
Guide architectural considerations for software verification including unit testing, static analysis and integration testing strategies
Ensure compliance with issue tracking and configuration management procedures
Simplify complex technical hardware and software issues and design elegant solutions
Identify and communicate risks before starting projects
Perform general documentation activities such as proofreading, formatting, and revising
Assist in the research and selection of hardware for embedded platforms
Lead technical reviews
Champion and identify potential improvements to the software development process and quality management system
Mentor junior engineers
Keep abreast of technical and industry trends related to embedded software development
Requirements:
BS degree in computer engineering, computer science, electrical engineering, and 5+ years of professional experience, or 8+ years of related professional experience
Experience designing and developing complex systems in embedded systems in C, utilizing industry best practices and design patterns
Experience including significant hardware interface, algorithm development and real-time operating systems
Significant experience with embedded microprocessor toolchains: compilers, debuggers, IDE, and source code control
Track-record of delegation, setting measurable goals and meeting them
Deep understanding and experience with the software development lifecycle
Extensive experience with communication protocols such as SPI, i2c, UART, CAN, USB or TCP/IP
Able to remain focused on project and company goals
Experience within the medical device or other regulated industry
Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills across cross-functional teams
Be positive, a team player yet self-motivated, and committed to working in a fast-paced environment
Nice to Have:
MS degree in computer engineering, computer science, electrical engineering or related technical discipline
Experience performing risk management of embedded software (e.g. DFMEA or FTA)
Experience with and understanding of IEC 62304 and/or FDA guidance and regulations
Experience leading teams of software engineers
Ability to read and interpret electrical schematics, and understand hardware designs
Experience in the selection of hardware for embedded platforms
Proficiency in at least one common scripting language such as Python
Experience with ARM Cortex and/or dsPIC processors
Experience developing touchscreen-based user interfaces
Background in biomedical engineering or other life science

description: Capable with Python and/or MATLAB; Ever dream of a job working with the latest XR headsets & the freedom to work from home (or wherever you're most productive)?...
job_title: Algorithms Developer for Virtual & Mixed Reality
post_body:
Ever dream of a job working with the latest XR headsets & the freedom to work from home (or wherever you're most productive)?
Want to solve challenging problems resulting in transforming how people interpret & understand complex data behind some of the world's most pressing issues?
We’re looking for a highly productive, self-motivated problem solver for Immersion Analytics’ core R&D team supporting our flagship immersive data visualization product.
Duties and Responsibilities:
Write, update, and maintain Object-Oriented and Functional-style computer programs
3D & XR application development
Work with emerging SDKs, headsets & devices (we often have access before generally available)
Scene building, modification, and testing
Software design using flowcharts, diagrams and other planning methods.
Work with 3D artists to design workflows and import models.
Work with 3D models, textures, materials, shaders, and sounds to build cohesive and immersive environments.
Correct errors by making appropriate changes and rechecking the program to ensure that the desired results are produced.
Conduct trial runs of programs and software applications to be sure they will produce the desired information and that the instructions are correct.
Perform or direct revision, repair, or expansion of existing programs to increase operating efficiency or adapt to new requirements.
Consult with managerial, engineering, and technical personnel to clarify program intent, identify problems, and suggest changes.
Compile and write documentation of program development and subsequent revisions, inserting comments in the coded instructions so others can understand the program.
Write end user and developer documentation such as user guides and API docs
Consult with and assist computer operators or system analysts to define and resolve problems in running computer programs.
Ability to work independently as well as coordinate tasks and requirements with other developers and managers
Requirements
Patience to learn how existing code works, quick learner
One year of experience with the functional style of programming, preferably in C#
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, preferably with an impressive academic transcript in your algorithms & discrete mathematics coursework
Solid command of mathematics used in 3D graphics
Impressive Github or other project examples you can code review
At least two years’ hands-on experience developing for HoloLens using Unity & C# with
Superb C# knowledge & debugging skills
Capable with Python and/or MATLAB; Bitbucket, Jira, Git, Visual Studio, and developing for MS Windows. UWP experience a plus.
At least 2 years’ experience delivering high-quality enterprise software on-time & on-budget. Experience writing & maintaining production-grade code
Able to plan & work on fixed deadlines
Founded in 2015, Immersion Analytics is the world leader in immersive analytics software & solutions. The company's unique ability to distill hundreds of data screens into a single intuitive visualization, communicate the workings of complex AI and machine learning models, and increase data analysis productivity by up to 400x is valued by some of the world's largest financial institutions, medical research groups & defense contractors.
Job Type: Full-time
Experience:
Unity C#: 2 years (Required)
Education:
Bachelor's (Required)
Location:
Natick, MA (Preferred)
Work authorization:
United States (Required)
